content: I was writing about this ACT community server running on Zulipchat, which is a lot of words. Shorter names that came to mind were Zulip forum, Z-forum and ACT forum. Clearly the latter is most descriptive, so I'll go with that for now. Just sharing the thought.

David Tanzer said:

Shorter names that came to mind were Zulip forum, Z-forum and ACT forum. Clearly the latter is most descriptive, so I'll go with that for now.

I'd say the ACT Zulip, because there could potentially be other fora on other platforms in the future.
That is concise, but idiosyncratic, as most people won't know what a Zulip is.

David Tanzer said:

That is concise, but idiosyncratic, as most people won't know what a Zulip is.

I'd say the capital Z is a hint to most people that this is a proper noun and, hence, something they should google if they're not familiar with the name. Notice that I've decapitalised the G in Google, because it's now so commonplace to say "google" for "look for something using a search engine" (like how people used to say "xerox", or how we'd say "scotch tape") that it seems superfluous to capitalise the word.

While I am enjoying engaging with applied folks on here, I by no means consider myself an applied category theorist (yet!). Also the heading in the top right just reads "Category Theory". So maybe drop the A to be more inclusive?
Yeah, this isn't an ACT forum, it's a CT forum which pretty much has just one channel for ACT
We did discuss making something specifically for ACT right at the beginning. I was against it, I thought ACT was too small
My suggestion would be contracting CATegory theory zuLIP to catlips, if only to see the look on peoples faces when I say it
The "official" name for this place has been the "Category theory community server".

But I'm not gonna insist on that. I do insist that it's about category theory, not just applied category theory. And I don't see why we need to call it something that contains the brand name "Zulip". That's just the underlying technology.

Would it be bad to call it the "category forum"? Are there other category forums?

Maybe we don't need to call it something containing "zulip", but that's the most natural thing for many people (including myself) to call it, because that's what it is. I have a much easier time remembering what "the category theory zulip" is than "the category theory community server".
I just drop the link and say "here".
